description:
Best soy mochas in Pacific Heights. Yes, soy! You can't even tell it's not rich milk! 

I usually enjoy spending a few hours here working quietly. The staff is so helpful and the food is delicious. The space is welcoming but doesn't ever really seem to feel over crowded or intimidating. Highly recommend.
author: Liz C.

description:
Went in for a coffee and some food - the almond milk latte was awesome, and the avocado toast with egg and bacon was tasty.

Only complaint would be the dirty tables and dishes that were left on some of the tables.

Great local spot though!
author: Cameron R.

description:
This place is very cute. They have plenty of seats and lots of outlets if you're going to do work (which a lot of people do). The staff is super friendly and welcoming. 

I had a chai latte, which was really good! Good balance of creamy and spicy. 

I just got a bagel with cream cheese to eat, but I'd like to come back and try some other things. The menu looks great. 

The only problem I had was that I had the WORST internet connection. Seems like I was the only one with this problem, since lots of other people were on their laptops and seemed unbothered. But it was frustrating. 

Overall, I'd give it another try, maybe when I'm not working!
author: Natalie K.

description:
Stopped in for a quick bite before leaving town and had a very nice experience. My husband had the coconut chia pudding bowl which he loved (it actually inspired me to make some once we got home) and I went with the veggie avocado toast. The toast was delicious (avocado with some chopped onions, tomatoes, and cucumber) but it was definitely a smaller portion than I expected. Which was fine. I just wish I had ordered something else since I was about to get on a 5 hour plane and wouldn't be landing until 9pm local time, so wanted to something that would last me for the day. The fella next to me had the bagel sandwich and that was the direction I should have gone for sure. It looked awesome. I'd definitely do the toast again, but maybe as fuel for a long day I'd go with something more hearty. 

I also got the cold brew coffee which was fantastic.

Seating is limited so we had to share the big hightop communal table with a few other patrons and it was fine.
author: Annette J.

description: Stopped by in search of brekkie, caffeine, and WiFi. The barista was incredibly friendly, patient, and gave good advice for what to order based on my hunger level. I settled on a bacon quiche and cold brew. The quiche was very filling, and a great value for $6 compared to other menu items, which were also pretty good deals. The quiche was heated up, served with an orange slide, salty, and carby, as quiches should be. The cold brew was decent and appropriately large for my caffeine-deprived self. WiFi kept cutting in and out for me, which was mildly annoying, but not sure if that's a personal laptop issue. Overall, it was a great start to the day!
author: Naomi S.

description:
A low key cafe addition on Polk Street selling easy breakfast items (think avocado toast, quiche), coffees, and a variety of Vietnamese sandwiches.

This place is unpretentious and although the prices are pretty low (relative to other breakfast/brunch around Polk), the food that comes out are also pretty unsophisticated. 

If you're looking for a fast, value option in a hip part of town with great coffee and great people watching, this is your spot.
author: Linda X.

description:
Came here for a quick almond milk latte. 

Great latte, great service, great efficiency. No complaints whatsoever. I also got an oolong tea which I was very pleased about since not many cafes have oolong. Oolong has a lot of health benefits including the inhibition of fat absorption.

Highly recommend for any type of caffeination. Also seems like a great place to do some work. Good ambience with good music level.
author: Ezra B.

description:
I did not enjoy my time here. Two of our orders were wrong and had to be taken back. I also ordered and paid for the avocado toast with bacon and poached egg. I was told afterwards that there was no toast left, so I substituted croissant for the toast. They then served me a weird croissant breakfast sandwich with scrambled eggs. After finishing my meal, I saw another customer, who came after me, receive a salmon meal that was served on toast! I'm not sure what they meant by saying they were out of toast. 

I had a confusing and very unsatisfying visit. I do not plan on coming back. Please, for the sake of future customers, check that you have all the correct ingredients before receiving orders, and pay attention to what your customers are ordering.
author: Jowain S.

description:
Vegan bahn mi was everything It was cracked up to be. The tofu was chewy and seasoned well, the pickled veggies were crunchy, and I added the spicy jalapeño as well. Honestly not too spicy alone, but a dash of sriracha brought It all together nicely. And the baguette was nice and warm and crispy... just how I love my bahn mi's. And for $6.50? Can't beat that.

Pros:
Bahn mi
Vegetarian options 
Service
Not crowded

Cons: 
None
author: Vyshak C.

description:
You need a back-up plan because everybody needs a back-up plan. My back-up plan is to come here when Saint Frank on the next block is too full up which is quite often on Saturdays. That place can get crazy-busy where getting coffee to go is your only viable option since the laptoppers have taken over all the available tables. So then where do you go? I guess down Polk Street to Aquatic Park at which point you've already emptied out the cup. That's when I realized I needed a Plan B, and the Fueling Station is my Plan B. It doesn't feel nearly as harried or crowded as Saint Frank even though the leftover laptoppers appear to spill over here.

With a bit of a Vietnamese twist, this is more of a family-run cafe since they serve actual food here, a quirky hodgepodge of salads, waffles and banh mi sandwiches, but the coffee and tea still appear to be the main focus and what most customers order. I went with a $3.25 Iced Green Tea (photo: http://bit.ly/2eOxIqt) and was able to secure a table without incident as I was waiting for Jamie W. to arrive. It was so refreshing I ordered a follow-up, the $3.50 'Amish' Palmer made with iced tea and Amish-style lemonade where they squeeze the lemons through a sieve (photo: http://bit.ly/2vSMVN6). The effort was worth it as it was downright thirst-quenching.

BEVERAGES - 4 stars...refreshing drinks on a warm summer afternoon
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...more relaxing than Saint Frank, that's for sure
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...certainly nice enough though they favor the regulars
TOTAL - 4 stars...my back-up plan on Polk
author: Ed U.

description:
Food: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Atmosphere: 3/5
Value: 4.5/5

I recently stopped here for a quick brunch in SF since my friend lives close by, and we ordered the salmon toast and the avocado toast w/ the works. Both were very good, and a great value for the price here in San Francisco. The one point I have to make is that they give you so much toast, it's a huge slab. Probably unnecessary, and diluted the salmon taste in my dish. Their eggs are poached beautifully though. 

Their service is also really amazing, and I appreciated how helpful and friendly everyone was! It has a very home-y feel, and you don't feel corporate at all, which I really liked. The outside tables were perfect, as it was a gorgeous day, but inside it was rather dark and hot. Not super crowded, even at 11 on a Sunday, which was nice. This is definitely a gem. 

Will definitely return if I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Whitney G.

description: Solid bacon, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel. $7 for 3 toppings works for me.
author: Joe F.

description:
If you want good coffee, excellent service, and a bite to eat go down the block to Saint Franks or Royal Grounds Coffee. If you don't mind Starbucks or Peet's (also close by) I would suggest going there instead of Fueling Station. 

I dropped my iced coffee while I was adding creamer. The staff was incredibly rude. Other coffee shops (where this has happened) have given me a new drink free of charge. However, the registrar (male) was a jerk about it. The service here is terrible. Despite being close and convenient, I will not be coming here again.

Here's my two cents on the "food:" The pastries here are almost always stale and taste artificial. 

The avocado toast is sub-par. The Levain bread is hard as rock, and analogous to the stinginess of the staff here, the avocado slivers are minimal.
author: S W.

description: I was here to work on something and needed WiFi! Love the atmosphere and their tea selection and food! I tried one of their black teas and the short cake waffle with strawberries and real whipped cream! Delicious!! Pro tip: they have happy hour from 3-5pm which was get a cup/pot of tea and food was 50% off!
author: Theresa H.

description:
Cute place at the far end of Polk St. so less crowds. Perfect for studying or doing work as there are outlets, coffee, and selection of yummy foods. A couple of tables outside as well to enjoy people watching and the sunshine :) I came here before a workout down the block at Crunch - How perfect that it's called Fueling Station...

Can only vouch for the Tofu Banh Mi but was very impressed. It wasn't exactly TOFU which I've experienced before, it was more like the sponge-like tofu, which was more flavorful because it soaked the flavors very well. The bread was perfectly toasted and still soft/doughy rather than being as hard as a rock - these baguettes can be scary as they have frequently scratched up the roof of my mouth (I also eat too fast). They have the option of mayo or Sriracha aioli - I got the mayo and they added the perfect amount. Jalapeños are added upon request as well, as a lot of people pick them out anyways.  

Another place to add to my go-to Sunday coffee shops I can coop up at.
author: Vickie Z.

description: This is one of Russian Hill's best kept secrets - I love this place!  I come here at least once a week for the avocado toast with bacon and a poached egg (always prepared to perfection) and also bring friends there when they are in town. I've also tried other items off the menu and was never disappointed. I also call in orders to go sometimes and they are always ready in a timely manner and packaged neatly. The ladies who work there are always friendly which is an added plus. Give this place a try -- you'll keep coming back!
author: Amaya G.

description:
I stumbled upon Fueling Station while walking to Saint Frank after my morning Saturday workout. Saint Frank was too crowded and I was too tired to wait in a loud, hipster spot that day so I decided to check out Fueling Station. It's a very lowkey, simple cafe with a good selection of food and drink options. 

I ordered a cappuccino and croissant sandwich and sat a table out front. Both my coffee and sandwich were great and at a very reasonable price. I will definitely be coming back again soon!

TIP: They have a happy hour deal from 3-6 (i think?) where you can get any one food item half off when you order a pot of tea.
author: Estelle C.

description:
I wanted to give this great establishment 5 stars; but that'll have to wait for my next visit! We needed a place that opened early for brunch because we had an early flight to catch out of SFO. They open at 0700, we arrived at 0650 just in case it'd be busy! We entered at 0701 to have the lady tell us that the brunch won't be able to be made until 0720, we needed to leave at 0725. We stayed and had great coffee and delicious quiche. But all we wanted/needed was the avocado toast! #yolo 
Next time please have everything ready 0700.
Thank you!
author: Artem R.

description:
Came here on a PERFECTLY sunny day in the city! Absolutely amazing to grab a sammie and head to the beach and Golden Gate park. Was greeted warmly and met with a smile at the counter. 

It took me awhile to order, but I ended up with the COMBINATION PORK BANH MI. I added some sriracha aioli and extra cilantro like I normally do with my banh mi. Now....I'm no banh mi expert but have probably had one about every 2ish weeks for the past few years. It's cheap, easy and very tasty after all! I've been to some of the banh mi hype places like Saigon Sandwich off Larkin and Café Bunn Mi on Clement (both being really really good, don't get me wrong!), but this place actually SURPRISED me. I can actually say it was one of the best banh mi I've had. The combination of the right amount of crisp on the bread and the freshness and depth of the non-fake pork set my tastebuds tingling. Or just generally it was really freaking good!

Come here and bring a friend to get FUELED up!
author: Daniel O.

description:
EDIT: I talked to the management of the cafe and they were super gracious. They refunded me what I spent on the toast and offered to give me another item for free. I don't live in the area, so I probably won't be back, but I have much more good will towards this place. 

I was just served the worst salmon toast I've ever had the misfortune to encounter, as should be evident from the photo. The poached egg was boiled through, the salmon tasted old, and the plate was scattered with crumbs and looked very unprofessional for the $10.50 I wasted on it. It's a cute spot, but I'm thoroughly turned off.
author: Sophie H.

description: I live for this place!  Great people, relaxed vibe and yummy food!  I love the avocado toast and the vegan bahn mi!  Can't go wrong here!
author: L F.

description: I have been in a few times over the past year with my running group and like the aesthetic of this cafe. It has two larger tables for groups and a number of small tables for people working. For a small cafe that lacks a full kitchen their food is quite good. I would recommend the croissant sandwich or the waffle with strawberries.
author: Lauren B.

description: I'm just mad right now. My avocado toast + veggies + poached egg was $9.50 and the serving size was pitiful! The toast was cool. The avocado, great. But veggies? Two grape tomatoes diced and a handful of chopped onion. The poached egg was perfect, but for $10 I expected a more substantial serving. Now it's less than 2 hours later, and I'm hungry again.
author: L F.

description: Amazing and well priced banh mi. Vietnamese coffee is fantastic and the Vietnamese owner is SO nice. Free Wi-Fi too!
author: Courtney C.

description:
Really cute place with great and prompt service! Probably best if you brought your laptop and computer, but not worth the money if you wont be able to enjoy the ambiance 

The stars reflect my thoughts on their house made chai. I overheard that the ratio is 60/40 chai:milk which I got excited about because I hate when chais taste like milk flavored chai. I also liked that you could choose sweeten vs unsweetened chai. But the chai did pretty much taste like milk with a hint of chai. I thought the spices / ginger flavor that chai should be weren't there. The drink was also lukewarm.

If you're looking for chai - go to samovar!!!
author: Jeanie N.

description: This cute little spot was a great place to have a quick and filling breakfast for a great price! I ordered the $4 avocado toast, and yes it wasn't extraordinary or anything, yet it was definitely enjoyable. I also got the oatmeal and loved it. My friend got a quiche and she said it was delicious. The portions are small but good for the price you pay, and the options were quite abundant. I hope to come here again soon to try their coffee/tea and other dishes.
author: Mina D.

description:
Soooo my beef with this place is that it's a coffee shop. And coffee shops are usually busy in the morning. So having more than one employee working during the morning would probably be worthwhile....

I've been plenty of times on the weekend where multiple employees are working and getting a coffee is a breeze, but during the morning if you walk in and see someone in front of you, you'll need to make a decision on whether you want to be late for work or get your latte. Seriously, the barista in the morning takes a long time and since she's the only one it takes awhile even if you're the only one in the cafe.

The coffee is good though, but if you're in a rush save this spot for the weekend!
author: Elliott W.

description: Loved this little spot! I got the avocado toast and my fiancé got bacon egg and cheese croissant. The avocado toast was so simple, so at first I was wishing I got the croissant. But once I tried it, it was really delicious. My fiancé and I ended up sharing our breakfasts because both were so good!!!
author: Lisa M.

description: Clean and nice. Light and original meals. Found it on yelp and it was a nice tip. Prices low and very easy to get a meal and drink for less than 10. Good coffee.
author: Jesper L.

description:
Small latte comes with 2 shots? Bet.  Got a iced soy latte with an add shot. I think this brought me up to 4. #aboutthatlife I appreciate the smoothness of the espresso. It didn't overpower the soy. I regret not asking about the brand or roast. 

I tried their caprice waffle which delicious but was way too small for $6. It's served like a sandwich and granted 2 came in my order. I would've preferred a larger portion.

This is clearly a neighborhood café but not the communal kind. Everyone one was glued to their laptops with their headphones. A bit too quiet for me and I was reading a damn book. 

I enjoy the outdoor seating and friendliness of the barista that served me. Feels like a bit of disconnect between the business and its clientele but I'd fault that more on the neighborhood than the owner.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great little neighborhood spot for coffee and a quick bite. The matcha latte I ordered was very well-made and the organic vegan granola was delicious. This cafe is also really well-priced - especially for nob hill.
author: Sam M.

description: The food was really good, but I give it four stars because the coffee wasn't so great. I ordered two items from the "brunch bites menu", the lox, & avocado toast. We also ordered a waffle from the traditional menu, it was AMAZING, I highly recommend it. It was so soft and buttery and fluffy on the inside. The americano was flat, tasted kind of like old burnt espresso, the cortado was better, but not great. It was decent. I would go back for the food, but not for the coffee. Customer service was good, but they seemed a little stressed out or pressed for time, it wasn't that crowded so maybe there was something going on behind the counter :) I do recommend it though, especially if you want a quick bite.
author: Sonya O.

description:
Get The Chocolate Peppermint Cake While You Can!
I'm guessing its a holiday thing...but the chocolate peppermint cake is OFF the HOOK! Great neighborhood coffeeshop, avocado toast is delish but "get the chocolate peppermint cake while you can"! Can't be said enough.
author: Rita M.

description:
Great spot in Russian hill!
We came back for a second time after a great experience at first.
A very modest, calm coffe place, with a fresh great taste coffe, and a small but delicious vary of sandwiches, salads and sweets. Vegan options too.
The Buddha sandwich was great. And the Batista lady was very welcoming and nice.
This place won't let you down
author: Yarin D.

description:
Stopped into this cute new coffee shop after my hair appointment this weekend.  I was waiting for my friend to meet up and wanted a little tea and somewhere to hang out for a few minutes when I saw the 'fueling station' across the street.  This looks like a new and nice addition to this side of Polk street.  This coffee shop is bright, inviting and super clean but also has a comfortable and homey feel to it.  There are several tables (with lots of outlets) for studying or changing your phone, etc while you dine in. Far in the back there is a couch and what appears to be a child friendly area with some toys, etc for the kiddos. 

The staff was super friendly here.  I decided to get a loose leaf tea and grabbed a cup of coconut ($3).  I grabbed a table and the girl working the counter brought my tea over to me.  With fresh chunks of coconut in it, this tea was delicious.  In all it seemed like everyone here was just in a good mood.  The staff was so friendly, some neighborhood locals were catching up over coffee and waffles and in all just a pleasant place to hang out.  

Free wi-fi for customers and impeccably clean bathrooms.  I did see a large selection of Bah-mi sandwiches, oatmeal, pastries, etc  and serving contraband coffee (yum).  I'll come back again for sure to check out more items.
author: Kelsey B.

description: I love this place!!!!! It's soooo good. I've been avidly going to Starbucks but this place is worth walking a few extra blocks. The waffles, and lattes are fantastic. I especially like the owner, not so much her coworker who's pretty grumpy most days. Great place. Great atmosphere.
author: Gina B.

description: Staff is warm and welcoming. Prices are in-line with what one would expect for Polk Street, and the space is nice / clean. Recommend the waffles and avocado toast!
author: Brian K.

description: Really like this place. It's got a clean look, nice tables and chairs and an area where you can lounge in the back on a big sofa. Sorry, first come first serve for the sofa. Lol. The customer service here is very accommodating and the female employee or owner(?), is sooo nice! I had an Americana and a croissant with egg and bacon. Tasty! Will be back to try the bahn mi sandwiches.
author: William Y.

description: The tofu banh mi is to die for!  I would say it's the only reason I come here, but I also come here for the cleanliness, nice staff, wifi and plugs, and comfortable seating.  All around great cafe, and I'm happy to go out of my way to come do work here.
author: Roxie S.

description: Living in SF for a few years now and being an avid lover of breakfast foods, I am always searching for the best brunch places! This is one of the best for far + one of the most affordable in the area! We came here because it was 2:30 and all the regular brunch places were closed. This gem serves breakfast ALL DAY!!!! I ordered a croissant sandwich (which you can personalize) and iced coffee. The homemade cupcakes are also extraordinary with their special frosting. My friend enjoyed the food and amazing customer service so much he made me take a photo with the owner. Needless to say we will back!!!!
author: Karissa S.

description:
So very excited this is finally open. The void left in my heart by Brew is finally cured, and it's even better. The update to the interior is so inviting, the food is amaaaazing and the coffee is delicious too. Plus, most importantly in a neighborhood coffee shop, the owner is so kind and a lady boss and I hope our neighbors show the love. 

Their story: http://hoodline.com/2016/11/get-to-know-the-fueling-station-a-new-cafe-coming-to-polk-street
author: Kathleen L.

description: This is my very favorite place in the world for vegan banh mi sandwiches and avocado toast.  Soooo delicious.  Great Coffee.  Great service.  Great atmosphere.  Great location.  Love it.  Can't wait to return.  Thanks, Lily.
author: Cindi R.

description: Awesome little spot! Our avocado toast with poached eggs hit the spot. Will definitely be back here.
author: Megan T.

description: This place is so chill! And the owner is very warm and welcoming so that was what made this place stand out to begin with. Then, I ordered my bahn mi sandwich with double meat (pork and chicken mixup) and it was absolutely fantastic! The flavor of the meet paired with a Sriracha sauce and sweet carrots made the perfect combo! Highlight recommend for ambiance and the food!
author: Michael A.

description: This is my favorite local coffee/breakfast/lunch spot. The food is delicious a especially the banana nut bread and the bahn mi. My regular drink order is a latte and I never order anything else because it's always perfect. I love doing work here and the people who own/work the place are so lovely. I'm moving out of the Russian Hill neighborhood and I will sincerely miss coming here at least once a week. I will be back to visit!
author: Nidhi D.

description: Go-to spot for matcha lattes and breakfast sandwiches. Folks are the nicest, great setup to work at the cafe and super reasonably priced. A fave.
author: Alex B.

description:
Love this place! It's one of my neighborhood favorites. It provides plenty of indoor seating as well as a few outdoor tables to enjoy the sunshine. The staff is inviting and warm. I usually get a mocha and the chef's salad and both are lovely. 

This is the perfect place to grab coffee with a friend or enjoy a nice day working on your computer. It has wifi as well as plenty of outlets.
author: Kaci B.

description: Since my last review, the owner, Lilly, has been putting out a variety of delicious baked goods everyday - muffins, scones, cookies, croissant, cakes, pies... Our favorites are the bacon/cheddar/chive scone and the gorgeous peach and blueberry pies.  They are baked on site daily and you can just taste the difference!  I love supporting this small, independent, family owned gem in our neighborhood.
author: H. L.

description: Delicious food!! Love this family run cafe! High quality ingredients and a diverse menu.  Great customer service always adds to the pleasant vibe. 5 stars.
author: Kim W.

description: Absolutely delightful little neighborhood cafe. I ordered the toast with avocado and it was delicious. Oh California and your avocados....sigh. My colleague ordered a breakfast sandwich and was equally satiated. And it wasn't super expensive. No small feat for SF.
author: Kenda S.

description: Mediocre avocado toast, we even got "the works" and it was just ok (I could make this at home for $2 or less). Latte was just ok. Walk half a block to Saint Frank for way better coffee.
author: Jenn K.

description: The sweetest staff and really tasty matcha latte- 100% organic real matcha.  My girlfriend and I stopped in randomly and left with smiles and a couple tasty treats!  The charming older lady managing the front reminded me of home with her motherly service and gave us a couple samples of the peppermint chocolate Bunt cake --which is one of the most moist cakes I've had! We will definitely be back to try some other items off the menu, but most certainly will be back for the service/ambiance!
author: Dan R.

description: I was here for the first time over the weekend, and it is already on the list of places I would go back again. Great coffee, plenty of outlets and seating for working, good wifi and above all super friendly staff. The prices are surprisingly affordable by SF standards. We need more places like this in the city - not overpriced hipster coffee shops with uncomfortable seats and intentionally non-existent wi-fi.
author: Ravi T.

description:
My favorite little café on Polk! It's not a place for exotic coffee or housemade pastries, but as a result, the prices can't be beat, and I never spend over $10 for breakfast. The lattes are just perfect on cold mornings. Love the banh mi and quiches as well. The café itself has plenty of seating options and loads of power outlets, so you can spend some time here. 

My favorite aspect of Fueling Station is the staff--every time I come in, they are so incredibly sweet and friendly. Love coming here!
author: Laura B.

description: Had the Happy Buddha Belly Tofu banh mi. Being a meat lover I was pretty impressed with the flavor and texture of the tofu. Also had the matcha latte which soothe my Texas soul. Nice little cafe that didn't disappoint.
author: John D.

description: My new favorite coffee/breakfast spot on Polk street. Love their savory breakfast options...really sets them apart from other coffee spots in the city. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, with a good memory for regulars. Highly recommended.
author: Connor C.

description:
Average but good breakfast sandwich. Good latte  but imperfectly steamed milk. 

Great local coffee from contraband. Good local loose leaf tea. Casual, simple, and spacious seating that's great for work or hanging with a friend. Excellent service
author: Brian D.

description:
Great atmosphere, great owners. They were so nice and it's important to them that every customer is happy with the service and the food.
When a customer arrived late in the night and the coffee machine was cleaned and closed, to make sure she is not leaving empty handed, they gave her tea on the house, just for the feel-good effect.

And the food is great!
author: Tal C.

description: Wonderful place with friendly staff and the best lemonade and "Amish" Palmer's I've had yet. One of my favorite spots in the city.
author: Marissa A.

description: Glad to see this place open in my neighborhood!  While I liked previous incarnation of this place, The Brew, Fueling Station did an incredible job with renovation and now the spot has a much lighter and brighter atmosphere.  Stopped in on a Sunday morning for a light breakfast and was pleasantly surprised at their menu options, including avocado toast, egg, bacon, banh mi sandwiches, etc.  Contraband Coffee and a nice selection of teas.  More comfortable space, and more seating than St. Frank, which I really prefer.  The owner was really sweet too.
author: Joanne G.

description:
My favorite place for lunch!!! Always delicious food, super friendly staff and great prices! 
Great to have you in our neighborhood :)
author: Olga C.

description: Everything is great, except... Always crowded. Always no seats because ppl sit around on their laptops for hours. Always a super long and slow line.
author: Joshua G.

description: I had a turkey, egg, avocado, bacon and Swiss cheese croissant with a black tea to drink and it was great. Kept me full until lunch time. Fast service! Thankful I had the opportunity to visit from Orange County.
author: Jasmine S.

description: This place is so cute. The atmosphere is open and clean. The staff are friendly. We had the strawberry shortcake waffles, and it was so yummy! Totally hit the spot. Also had a latte and cookie. Life is too short to run on empty.
author: Stephanie N.

description: Breakfast today.  Cute area with outdoor seating.  Food was good but it took forever and they messed up our order completely.  I ordered a bagel w ham, avocado and egg.  It was good but took two times to get what I ordered.  First they brought two strawberry waffles and we ordered one.  Took it back and brought two avocado toast and a side of bacon.  It was good but nothing special.  Waited another fifteen minutes and watched them name my bagel sandwich.  Good but needed seasoning.  Would not go. Ack with all the other choices.
author: Lori M.

description: Good coffee and the people working there are so nice. Definitely a place to frequent!
author: Tammy Y.

description: Charming little place that has a great selection of food and drinks at a great price. I got the chicken Banh Mi and Amish Palmer. In case you were wondering, it has mint and honey in it. The owners are friendly and I was able to do my work with easy access to a wall socket and in a nice calming atmosphere.
author: Carly H.

description:
Ordered a cold brew.  They only had enough to fill up half my serving. They proceeded to add extra ice and offered to add regular drip coffee to make up for it. How is this a cold brew? 

Cute place, but maybe I came on an off day.
author: Guillermo M.

description: Best coffee and brunch spot on Polk! The cafe and staff are both warm and welcoming and the coffee is consistently extraordinary!
author: Sarah M.

description: This is a great place to have breakfast. We ordered bagel and lox, Belgian waffles and a toast with avocado, lox and packed egg and everything was delicious! The hot teas were very good as well. I think it's the best place I've had breakfast in SF.
author: Ekaterina I.

description: Nice little place for a coffee and breakfast sandwich. Hard to beat $5.50 for a ham egg and cheese croissant in SF.
author: Mike F.

description:
A very nice place! Spent a whole day working here. They have awesome avocado sandwiches and amazing cookies, which they bake themselves. 
Music is not not too loud and a lot of outlets, great place to work at.
author: Borys P.

description: I love this place that just opened up on my block. Coffee is amazing, food delicious and the barista is so friendly. Big couch in the back to do work and not too crowded. Such a hidden gem
author: Eleni K.

description: Stopped here for lunch before heading up the coast.  I got the caprese waffle and my husband had the chicken banh mi.  Food was amazing, coffee had super flavor.  Great service and cute, stylish ambience.  Would definitely come here again!
author: Ashley Z.

description: Wonderful neighborhood coffee shop. Family run, tasty coffee, simple good food. About a block away from the hubbub on Polk so it's quieter and more peaceful.
author: Bill R.

description: Everything here is awesome!   They take such care when making. Your food and drinks. Everything is made from scratch...you can taste it!  The chicken ban mi is so good we ordered some as appetizers for our wedding.  Whatever you order here will be great. The staff is also very friendly and courteous.
author: Miss L.

description:
Fueling Station has been my go-to since it's opening day. In an area that offers either sit down service or strictly coffee, this place feels, smells, and tastes like you are in your best friend's kitchen. Lillian, the owner, welcomes you in as if you were in her home every morning. The coffee is Contraband and the food is delicious. 

Ok, once you've had your coffee fix, try her Amish Lemonade. It's amazing. The menu speaks for itself but if you're feeling a bit sweet & a bit savory, just tell her. The things this woman does with waffles will have you running back for a refuel in no time. My favorite is the caprese waffle with a poached egg on top. 

Don't think too hard about it. Just stop by, say hello, and fuel up.  As the chalkboard reads, "life is too short to run on empty".
author: Kara C.

description: I'm really glad this place arrived in Russian Hill, where there aren't a ton of "grab-and-go" smaller food spots. I go for the delicious veggie banh mi especially, and sometimes the coffee. The place also has free wifi, chill interior, a lot of seating, and friendly employees. Check em' out!
author: C F.

description: I just had the bacon cheddar chive scone today. This is the height of delicious goodness for bacon lovers. You HAVE to savor this. Your tastebuds will divorce you if you don't! This is, by, far, the most relaxed cafe with the best light food in the City; San Francisco's version of a local neighborhood Parisian cafe.
author: Julien N.

description: WiFi is not working well, I ordered a chicken sandwich , not good and the chicken tasted raw and unfresh, the heat is not working as well , I felt cold and people kept coming in and out of the back door . Not recommend
author: Momo P.

description: Love this new spot on Polk! So far I have tried The Works (avocado toast with incredible poached egg and other tastiness), the oatmeal with dried fruit and bananas, the low fat yogurt and granola, the coffee and the chai. All fantastic and reasonably priced. The atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming and the folks that work here are really accommodating and show tremendous care for customer satisfaction (refilling coffee and almond milk right away and checking in to make sure we were happy with our meals).  Highly recommend stopping by if you are looking to feel at home.
author: Noelle F.

description: All I can say is I found a new favorite place in San Francisco wow. I walked in and got immersed with the amazing customer service from the mother and daughter combo that own the place! The prices were very good and could have been more because the food was delicious! Everything about this place from the photo gallery around the shop to the lounge couch in the back makes this place a sensational experience. I plan to come back so much it's not even funny. Thank you so much for brightening my day Fueling Station!
author: Verne P.

description: A Polk Street gem. Cozy and quiet with lots of space to work or relax. The owner and staff are warm and welcoming. Great choices for food and drink.
author: Yossi G.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and this is my go-to coffee spot. Great bunch selection and cold brew, what more could you ask for!
author: Rob S.

description: Yum! Love the Bahn Mi chicken salad - great alternative to the sandwich, if you like to cut back on gluten/carbs.
author: Yvette M.

description: Loved this place ! Tofu ban mi salad was soooo good . I've never had tofu that tasty . The sesame dressing went perfectly with it . Good coffee too .
author: Valerie P.

description: This is a hidden treasure that is one of the earliest to open in the morning on Polk St. Perfect to get done early morning work done or just grab quick breakfast after a workout. Offers a lot of sitting space inside. The avocado toast is a must try.
author: Harshad M.

description: such a cute atmosphere and amazing service! i got the tofu bahn mi and iced green tea and it was super yum. i wish i lived in san fran bc i would definitely go here with my laptop and work on stuff.
author: Annelise M.

description: New cute coffee shop in Russian Hill. The owner's mom is sometimes there and she's quite the hoot! Very friendly customer service and their homemade chai is delicious! Too many times people make their chai too sweet but their chai is perfect!
author: Stephanie J.

description: Great spot to grab some coffee or quick lunch by yourself or with friends. There's lots of seating (high tables, community table, as well as regular tables). Plenty of room and workspace so you can also bring your laptop along to do some work!
author: Ghazal S.

description: What a great way to start our day! Yummy food. We got a little of everything. Oatmeal for my hubby, strawberry topped waffle for my son, bagel and cream cheese for my daughter, and avocado toast with a poached egg for me. All more than satisfying!
author: Steffie S.

description: Perfect place for breaking your fasting and getting hopped up on coffee! Food was amazing! So much better than a huge fatty breakfast. You get unique items like avocado toast with poached eggs and bacon etc. If you want to try something different/better than the standard, for half the price of standard, come here!
author: Chris R.

description: I walked all the way from powell to try this place and it was totally worth it! Waffle and the latte taste sooo good. And this place is cozy and warm. I love the owner too. she is so friendly and nice person! I really love this place
author: Helen P.

description: So happy this is in the neighborhood! Great snacks and breakfast sandwiches, lots of gluten-free options too! Vietnamese coffee is the best, not too sweet and incredible flavor. The family runs a tight ship. Even when it's busy, they all seem to work in sync and get the food and drinks out fast. Their prices are extremely reasonable too, especially for Polk street! Only $4 for avocado toast! You could definitely have money left over to buy a house!
author: Maya B.

description: Great and awesome food, friendly people, relaxed atmosphere.  We would recommend a visit and definitely come back
author: Candace S.

description: A great place to go to unwind and enjoy a cup of joe or light cafe faire. A very nice addition to the neighborhood!
author: Ben H.

description: Excellent service, DELICIOUS sandwiches (get the chicken Bahn ami) and even better coffee :p
author: Taylor J.

description: Best waffles ever. 100% recommend coming here. Cute space and the owner is super sweet.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Very nice place! Good service and amazing food. You need to try the fantastic menu. 
A shop for having good time, enjoy with your partner and friends.
author: Alfredo D.

description: Truly a wonderful neighborhood spot. These ladies really care about their customers and he loyalty shows in the warm, friendly environment. Not to mention their drinks are uniquely hand-crafted and the food is great. I came in with a cold one day and they even whipped up a special family recipe to help soothe my cold!! You don't get service like this anywhere anymore. Come, come back often and stay awhile :)
author: C L.

description: I waited 40 minutes for Vietnamese coffee that was terrible. So terrible, in fact, that I threw it out, as soon as I left the cafe. The only reason I didn't ask for my money back is because I knew they would never be able to handle processing a refund in a timely manner. Absolutely no way will I be back here again. Save yourself the time and head down the street to St. Frank's.
author: Chidi A.

description: Best neighborhood coffee shop. Family run, very friendly, and great food/drinks. On a Saturday morning, you'll find many locals, bikers, and families in here for their morning coffee and breakfast. The community feel is great. Best bahn mi sandwiches (and I've been trying to find the best one in the city so have eaten many).
author: Harmony P.

description: Very nice neighborhood coffee shop. They did a great job renovating the interior and the new set up works very well. Their cold brew is solid and I had a delicious chocolate croissant. I will definitely be stopping by again for another tasty iced coffee.
author: Scoot S.

description: Such a great new neighborhood spot with friendly staff. The Matcha Latte is my favorite! And the bun me sandwiches are great too. Love having this place down the street from my apartment.
author: Natalie S.

description: Love this spot.  Coffee and food was amazing, staff was even better. Love this little spot.  We came for breakfast but I can't wait to come back for the bahn mi sandwiches.
author: Shelby L.

description: This place is amazing!  They have a fantastic tea selection, the BEST chai tea latte I have ever had, and wonderful customer service.  Plus, really good, FRESH breakfast sandwich
author: Georgia T.

description: Great coffee meticulously made and tasty snacks. Great addition to the neighborhood!
author: Mitchell C.
